info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CLEVELAND...GASTON...NORTHWESTERN YORK AND NORTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES UNTIL 1230 AM EDT... At 1144 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of thunderstorms with intense lightning along a line extending from 8 miles west of Gastonia to 11 miles north of York to 3 miles southeast of Gaffney, and moving southeast at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Gastonia, Shelby, Gaffney, York, Kings Mountain, Cherryville, Bessemer City, South Gastonia, Clover and Dallas. In addition to intense lightning, very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and saturated soil conditions will cause scattered trees and power lines to fall. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storms approach. Lake Wylie is in the path of these storms. Cloud to ground lightning and gusty winds will create dangerous boating conditions. Move to shore immediately.
